title: Turkey’s Erdogan Threatens EU With Wave of Refugees if It Doesn’t Support Syria Offensive
text:
ISTANBUL—President Recep Tayyip Erdogan urged the U.S. and other NATO allies to back Turkey’s military offensive in Syria, threatening to allow waves of Syrian refugees to head for European shores if his country doesn’t receive adequate support.

The offensive, which began Wednesday with air and ground attacks along the border with Syria, targets U.S.-backed Kurdish forces Turkey views as a terrorist threat. It has drawn broad political and popular support in Turkey, but elicited near-unanimous condemnation outside the country—including...
